meta.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) - Howard-Winneshiek Community School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasTwoColumnWideLeftLayout fsSection772 fsHasTheme2

div.p: Our mission is to prepare and empower our students to think creatively, serve, contribute and succeed locally and globally.
The District's professional staff consists of more than 100 full time teachers, 50% of whom have advanced degrees. The faculty is complemented by a support staff of skilled individuals.

At the Howard-Winneshiek Community School District, students are the center of everything we do! With the support of our school community, the dedication of our staff and the assistance of many volunteers, we continue to demonstrate excellence in student learning and achievement at all levels.
Howard-Winneshiek Community School District has 3 buildings in our district. Our staff is dedicated to providing excellent educational opportunities from Preschool through 12th grade.

Howard-Winneshiek CSD values the involvement of the entire community in our District. To find out more about us, we encourage you to explore our website, attend our student performances, events and competitions, or visit our school.
Our staff is here to assist you with any needs you may have. Please reach out to us today!

blockquote.p: During today's April 17th news conference Gov. Reynolds has ordered all of Iowa's schools to be closed for the remainder of the school year and all extracurricular activities are cancelled. More information to follow as soon as available about other end of the year events and retrieving items from classrooms and lockers.

div.h5: Following the guidelines from Governor Reynold's April 6, 2020 news conference all Howard-Winneshiek Community Schools outdoor athletic facilities and playgrounds are closed until further notice.

p.br: Dollars for Scholars awards night scheduled for May 6, 2020, is canceled due to the current pandemic.

div.p: Students will still receive awards and be recognized publicly in a way that is to be determined.
For donors whose scholarship is not affiliated with Dollars for Scholars, you will be responsible for publicizing the award on your own.

hr.h4: Delivery and Pickup of meals will be
Each Student will receive 5 days worth of Breakfast and Lunch
THERE WILL BE NO MEALS AVAILABLE APRIL 9, 10, 13 & 14

div.p: During the school closure, we are committed to providing free meals to our students. The District, through the Nutrition Services and Transportation Departments, are establishing drive-through or walk-up meal pick-up locations at a number of sites. Meal service will begin Monday, March 23rd. Students will be provided lunch for the day and breakfast for the following day.

hr.p: The following resources are available to help the public stay informed about COVID-19.

li.a: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
How to talk to your kids about Coronavirus
Comic used to talk to your kids about Coronavirus

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: During today's April 2nd 2020 news conference Gov. Reynold's has ordered all of Iowa's schools to be closed until April 30th. This includes all normal school day activities and all extra-curricular activities.
I would just like to thank everyone again for their understanding during this unprecedented time.
Visit our Coronavirus page for updates. Thank you for your understanding during this time.
